trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlReader"></xref> implementation that reads object graphs and generates a XAML node stream.
Use the XamlObjectReader in scenarios where you want to process an object graph, which is typically the object graph of an application that is originally generated from a XAML source.
You might use the XamlObjectReaderwhere a round trip is made from a XAML start point to a XAML end point.

Or you might run a XamlObjectReader over the object graph; process the intermediate XAML node stream, if it is required, by using APIs on <xref:System.Xaml.XamlType> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember>; and then use <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlWriter> to serialize XAML nodes to XML.
More advanced scenarios might supply a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlWriter> override and a specific XAML schema context that the XamlObjectReader uses and then passes to the writer override.

Typical scenarios for using XamlObjectReader call the members that XamlObjectReader implements; they also call <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.Close%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.ReadSubtree%2A>, and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.Skip%2A> from the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader"></xref> class.

If initialized with this constructor, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader> object has the initial settings of a default <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReaderSettings>object and the initial context of a default <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext>.
The root of the object tree / object graph to read.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader"></xref> class with the specified reader settings.
The settings object specifies rules for reader operations, such as line number processing, error handling behavior, and so on.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReaderSettings>.
If initialized with this constructor, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader> object has the initial context of a default <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext>.
The root of the object tree to read.
A settings object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader"></xref> class with the specified schema context.
If initialized with this constructor, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader> object has the initial settings of a default <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReaderSettings> object.
The root of the object tree to read.
The schema context for the reader to use.
schemaContext is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader"></xref> class with the specified schema context and reader settings.
The settings object specifies rules for reader operations, such as line number processing and error handling behavior.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReaderSettings>.
The root of the object tree to read.
The schema context for the reader to use.
A settings object.
schemaContext is .
Gets the object instance that is available at the current reader position.
The object instance at the current reader position; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the reader position is not on an object.
Gets a value that reports whether the reader position is at the end of the file.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader position is at the end of the file; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the current <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlMember"></xref> at the reader position, if the reader position is on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType"></xref>.
The current member; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the reader position is not on a member.
Gets the XAML namespace declaration from the current reader position.
This property returns a non-null result only if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.NodeType%2A> property of the current reader position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType>.
It does not infer a namespace that is based on the context of other node types, such as an object in that namespace.
The XAML namespace declaration if the reader is positioned on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type of the current node.

When using the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader> APIs, you typically check the NodeType property after every operation that potentially advances the reader position, such as the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Read%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.ReadSubtree%2A>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.Skip%2A> methods.
NodeType indicates the information that you can obtain from the current reader position and the methods that you call next.

For example, you might access the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Member%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Type%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Value%2A>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Instance%2A> properties; or you might call the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.Skip%2A> method if you are not interested in the contents of the current node type.
The type of the current node.
Provides the next XAML node from the source object graph, if a node is available.
After you call the Read method and obtain a `true` result, you typically access the node properties.

Depending on the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.NodeType%2A> property, you can access the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Member%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Type%2A>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Value%2A>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.Instance%2A> properties.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a node is available; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets an object that provides schema information for the information set.

The schema context is a conceptual intermediary between a schema in the conventional sense, and the handling of XAML schema concepts by particular XAML processors (parsing, reading, and writing operations).
An object that provides schema information for the information set.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the object at the current reader position.
This property returns a non-null result only if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectReader.NodeType%2A> property of the current reader position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType>.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the object at the current reader position; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the position is not on an object.
Gets the value of the node at the current reader position.
The value of the current node; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, if the reader position is not on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType"></xref> node type.
